GOD.content: “pardon for not meaning (to say),” secretless secret of literature, scene of forgiveness, its being “up in the air,” keeps it secret, announces literature
GOD.linkedContent: “pardon for not meaning (to say),” secretless secret of literature, scene of forgiveness, its being “up in the air,” keeps it secret, announces literature

GOD.content: forgiveness as im-possible, experience of this impossibility is received differently
GOD.linkedContent: forgiveness as im-possible, experience of this impossibility is received differently

GT.content: gift interrupts economy, it’s not impossible but the impossible
GT.linkedContent: gift interrupts economy, it’s not impossible but the impossible

GT.content: “thinking found its fit only in the disproportion of the impossible.”
GT.linkedContent: “thinking found its fit only in the disproportion of the impossible.”

GT.content: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other
GT.linkedContent: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other

GT.content: “exhausting faculty” of “nature” given to narrator of “Counterfeit Money” as a “gift”: to look for what cannot be found where & when one is looking for it
GT.linkedContent: “exhausting faculty” of “nature” given to narrator of “Counterfeit Money” as a “gift”: to look for what cannot be found where & when one is looking for it

GT.content: to look for (chercher) the impossible is that form of madness
GT.linkedContent: to look for (chercher) the impossible is that form of madness

GT.content: looking for “noon,” origin w/out shadow, w/out dialectical negativity, not any madness: sleepwalk in the vicinity of the impossible
GT.linkedContent: looking for “noon,” origin w/out shadow, w/out dialectical negativity, not any madness: sleepwalk in the vicinity of the impossible

GT.content: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting
GT.linkedContent: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting

GT.content: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness
GT.linkedContent: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness

MONL.content: common language: “Yes, I only have one language, yet it is not mine” > the impossible, inhabiting logical contradiction [suffer & take pleasure in this statement]
MONL.linkedContent: common language: “Yes, I only have one language, yet it is not mine” > the impossible, inhabiting logical contradiction [suffer & take pleasure in this statement]

MONL.content: promise [of which I speak], promises the impossible, possibility of all speech, yields no messianic, eschatological content [saves nothing]; yet resembles messianism, soteriology [addressed to totally other, finite mortal, w/out hope], structural opening: messianism w/out messianicity
MONL.linkedContent: promise [of which I speak], promises the impossible, possibility of all speech, yields no messianic, eschatological content [saves nothing]; yet resembles messianism, soteriology [addressed to totally other, finite mortal, w/out hope], structural opening: messianism w/out messianicity

R.content: Nancy’s freedom without measure, incommensurable, presubjective, precratic, “measures itself against nothing”
R.linkedContent: Nancy’s freedom without measure, incommensurable, presubjective, precratic, “measures itself against nothing”

R.content: Derrida prefers to call this the impossible: impossible as the only possibility, the condition of possibility > the antinomy at the heart of every -nomy
R.linkedContent: Derrida prefers to call this the impossible: impossible as the only possibility, the condition of possibility > the antinomy at the heart of every -nomy

R.content: antinomy, impossibility, source of every autoimmune process
R.linkedContent: antinomy, impossibility, source of every autoimmune process

R.content: regulative Idea of Kant, a last resort, an alibi, w/ a certain dignity, can’t deny I might one day give in to it > infinite deferral or teleological vs. im-possible
R.linkedContent: regulative Idea of Kant, a last resort, an alibi, w/ a certain dignity, can’t deny I might one day give in to it > infinite deferral or teleological vs. im-possible

R.content: im-possible (nonnegative) seizes me here and now, nonvirtualizable, what is most undeniably real and sensible (like the other, differance of the other)
R.linkedContent: im-possible (nonnegative) seizes me here and now, nonvirtualizable, what is most undeniably real and sensible (like the other, differance of the other)

R.content: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)
R.linkedContent: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)

FL.content: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)
FL.linkedContent: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)

LOBL.content: impossible to tell which border forms the other, each comprehends the other by not comprehending the other > which one quotes the other?
LOBL.linkedContent: impossible to tell which border forms the other, each comprehends the other by not comprehending the other > which one quotes the other?

LOBL.content: life being drawn through by a line, edge where it is impossible to settle: arreté
LOBL.linkedContent: life being drawn through by a line, edge where it is impossible to settle: arreté

H.content: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one
H.linkedContent: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one

H.content: “impossibility of that ‘at the same time’ is at the same time what happens, once and every time, it is what is going to happen, what always happens”
H.linkedContent: “impossibility of that ‘at the same time’ is at the same time what happens, once and every time, it is what is going to happen, what always happens”

POO.content: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]
POO.linkedContent: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]

POO.content: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders
POO.linkedContent: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders

SPOM.content: guarantee of translatability as impossible as the disjunction of untranslatability
SPOM.linkedContent: guarantee of translatability as impossible as the disjunction of untranslatability

SPOM.content: deconstruction links an affirmation to the experience of the impossible, radical experience of perhaps
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction links an affirmation to the experience of the impossible, radical experience of perhaps

SPOM.content: w/out experience of the impossible, one might as well give up on justice and the event > this is more honest, giving up on good conscience, might as well confess (avouer)/declare economic calculations/checkpoints (douanes) ethics/hospitality (various messianisms) would still install at border of event (to screen [cribler] arrivant)
SPOM.linkedContent: w/out experience of the impossible, one might as well give up on justice and the event > this is more honest, giving up on good conscience, might as well confess (avouer)/declare economic calculations/checkpoints (douanes) ethics/hospitality (various messianisms) would still install at border of event (to screen [cribler] arrivant)

SPOM.content: the impossible (“to let the dead bury their dead”) is possible, absolute evil (fully present life which doesn’t want to hear/know death), takes place (peut avoir lieu) > on basis of this terrible possibility, justice is desirable (through but also beyond law, right) [cf. HST p. 399]
SPOM.linkedContent: the impossible (“to let the dead bury their dead”) is possible, absolute evil (fully present life which doesn’t want to hear/know death), takes place (peut avoir lieu) > on basis of this terrible possibility, justice is desirable (through but also beyond law, right) [cf. HST p. 399]

HASD.content: from the moment I open my mouth, I have already promised at least to say: it is necessary to be silent > speak of the promise w/in the promise, as necessary as it is impossible: inscribes us by its trace in language—before language
HASD.linkedContent: from the moment I open my mouth, I have already promised at least to say: it is necessary to be silent > speak of the promise w/in the promise, as necessary as it is impossible: inscribes us by its trace in language—before language

MPM.content: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning [affirmation is possible]
MPM.linkedContent: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning [affirmation is possible]

MPM.content: undecidable is the condition of deconstruction (on and in [sur, dans?] this condition); in the sense of condition of possibility and, at the same time, condition as situation or destiny
MPM.linkedContent: undecidable is the condition of deconstruction (on and in [sur, dans?] this condition); in the sense of condition of possibility and, at the same time, condition as situation or destiny

MPM.content: this limit, this finitude, makes one write; deconstruction makes a path of writing through the aporia (impossible); deconstruction thinks only on the level of the impossible
MPM.linkedContent: this limit, this finitude, makes one write; deconstruction makes a path of writing through the aporia (impossible); deconstruction thinks only on the level of the impossible

MPM.content: de Man: “deconstruction of metaphysics” is impossible because in being rhetorical (btwn trope & persuasion) it is literary (doesn’t resolve relation btwn literature & philosophy)
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: “deconstruction of metaphysics” is impossible because in being rhetorical (btwn trope & persuasion) it is literary (doesn’t resolve relation btwn literature & philosophy)

POOF.content: perhaps as arrivant, arrivant of perhaps: at last the thought of perhaps (will come) > prevails over impossible, possibilization of possible impossible: undecidable and therefore decisive
POOF.linkedContent: perhaps as arrivant, arrivant of perhaps: at last the thought of perhaps (will come) > prevails over impossible, possibilization of possible impossible: undecidable and therefore decisive

POOF.content: the 2 ways to say to oneself (keeping silent) that solitude is irremediable & friendship impossible, 2 ways to (se) partager the impossible: 1) compassionate [see p. 57], negative, keep silent in secret 2) affirmative, attune/join 2 disjointed jouissances at heart of dissociation itself, an ecstasy w/out plenitude [Nietzsche: open horizon w/out light]: a communion d’arrachement infini [see p. 57 Nietzsche: “finer still to join in laughing”]
POOF.linkedContent: the 2 ways to say to oneself (keeping silent) that solitude is irremediable & friendship impossible, 2 ways to (se) partager the impossible: 1) compassionate [see p. 57], negative, keep silent in secret 2) affirmative, attune/join 2 disjointed jouissances at heart of dissociation itself, an ecstasy w/out plenitude [Nietzsche: open horizon w/out light]: a communion d’arrachement infini [see p. 57 Nietzsche: “finer still to join in laughing”]

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s [?] virtual ‘perhaps,’ hypothesis w/out borders: in the process of exhausting the flesh of our events, uttermost live of our lives > no, not in the process of exhausting us, presence of such a process too reassuring, on verge of success: an absolute virtuality from which no event could escape, all becomes simply possible
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s [?] virtual ‘perhaps,’ hypothesis w/out borders: in the process of exhausting the flesh of our events, uttermost live of our lives > no, not in the process of exhausting us, presence of such a process too reassuring, on verge of success: an absolute virtuality from which no event could escape, all becomes simply possible

A.content: via Seneca, death (immanence of a disappearance) seals union of possible and impossible
A.linkedContent: via Seneca, death (immanence of a disappearance) seals union of possible and impossible

A.content: deconstruction: aporetic experience of the impossible
Derrida introduces the often cited: death is for Dasein the possibility of an impossibility
A.linkedContent: Derrida introduces the often cited: death is for Dasein the possibility of an impossibility

A.content: Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility, is this an aporia? do we situate it in the possibility of an impossibility or the impossibility? not the same thing [Derrida distinguishing his thought of impossible from Heidegger’s?] [cf. HST p. 387 there, Derrida remarks on their affinity]
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility, is this an aporia? do we situate it in the possibility of an impossibility or the impossibility? not the same thing [Derrida distinguishing his thought of impossible from Heidegger’s?] [cf. HST p. 387 there, Derrida remarks on their affinity]

A.content: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger pays no attention to logical form of contradiction (most proper possibility as possibility of an impossibility) > treats it as a condition of truth, its very unveiling (truth no longer measured in logical form of judgment)

A.content: greater and greater orientation toward death, for Heidegger, the incalculable nonmeasure [of truth], signifies possibility of measureless impossibility of existence
A.linkedContent: greater and greater orientation toward death, for Heidegger, the incalculable nonmeasure [of truth], signifies possibility of measureless impossibility of existence

A.content: unique aporia of “expecting death”: 1) impossibility itself, dying as the aporia, impossibility of being dead, of “existing” one’s death 2) or that this impossibility is possible, appears as such, at whose limits one waits, limits of truth, but also possibility of truth
A.linkedContent: unique aporia of “expecting death”: 1) impossibility itself, dying as the aporia, impossibility of being dead, of “existing” one’s death 2) or that this impossibility is possible, appears as such, at whose limits one waits, limits of truth, but also possibility of truth

SEC.content: no context, no code can enclose written syntagma > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)
SEC.linkedContent: no context, no code can enclose written syntagma > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)

PAS.content: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible
PAS.linkedContent: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible

VM.content: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained
VM.linkedContent: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained

VM.content: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics
VM.linkedContent: thought that seeks to go to its very end in its language, the end envisaged under name of finitude, should abandon words & themes of finite/infinite & everything they govern > this is the impossible of beyond metaphysics which confirms necessity for this incommensurable overflow to take support from metaphysics

VM.content: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger realized this in making difference [btwn Being & existent] fundamental

OH.content: alliance of capital and a-capital (the other of capital): this seems impossible, it is, such is the nature of all responsibility
OH.linkedContent: alliance of capital and a-capital (the other of capital): this seems impossible, it is, such is the nature of all responsibility

TC.content: idea of impossible theater of cruelty [Master Morality], w/out representation, which begins in repetition, doesn’t help regulate theatrical practice but helps conceive of its origin, limit, horizon of its death > Western theater encompassed w/in its own possibility, but repetition steals its center
TC.linkedContent: idea of impossible theater of cruelty [Master Morality], w/out representation, which begins in repetition, doesn’t help regulate theatrical practice but helps conceive of its origin, limit, horizon of its death > Western theater encompassed w/in its own possibility, but repetition steals its center

SH.content: untranslatability connected w/ difficult passage (no pasarán), aporia, that isolates one poetic language from another (& multiplicity w/in language) > also ce pas impossible
SH.linkedContent: untranslatability connected w/ difficult passage (no pasarán), aporia, that isolates one poetic language from another (& multiplicity w/in language) > also ce pas impossible

OS.content: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double
OS.linkedContent: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double

OS.content: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same
OS.linkedContent: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same

OS.content: the cum, or co- of coexsistence has meaning only on basis of its impossibility
OS.linkedContent: the cum, or co- of coexsistence has meaning only on basis of its impossibility

OS.content: conversely, space of possible coexistence is space of impossible coexistence > simultaneity only via synthesis, temporal complicity [cumplicity]
OS.linkedContent: conversely, space of possible coexistence is space of impossible coexistence > simultaneity only via synthesis, temporal complicity [cumplicity]

RGE.content: via Bataille, we must find a speech which maintains silence, necessity of the impossible: to say in language (of servility) that which isn’t servile > silence (among all words) “most perverse, most poetic”
RGE.linkedContent: via Bataille, we must find a speech which maintains silence, necessity of the impossible: to say in language (of servility) that which isn’t servile > silence (among all words) “most perverse, most poetic”

RGE.content: sovereignty is impossible—therefore it is not, it is “this loss (perte)”
RGE.linkedContent: sovereignty is impossible—therefore it is not, it is “this loss (perte)”

RGE.content: general economy is not sovereignty itself, there is no sovereignty itself, la souveraineté dissout les valeurs de sens, de vérité, de saisie-de-la-chose-même
RGE.linkedContent: general economy is not sovereignty itself, there is no sovereignty itself, la souveraineté dissout les valeurs de sens, de vérité, de saisie-de-la-chose-même

DST.linkedContent: along with Lacoue-Labarthe, urgent to break with familial resemblances (airs), avoid genealogical temptations, assimilation or specular projection

DST.content: and it’s not because they’re impossible that the temptation becomes more avoidable
DST.linkedContent: and it’s not because they’re impossible that the temptation becomes more avoidable

DST.content: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified
DST.linkedContent: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified

PIO.content: deconstruction is impossible, possibility is danger of rule-governed procedures
PIO.linkedContent: deconstruction is impossible, possibility is danger of rule-governed procedures

PIO.content: experience of the other as invention of the impossible (only possible invention)
PIO.linkedContent: experience of the other as invention of the impossible (only possible invention)

PIO.content: impossibility of inventing the other, thus only invention: beyond the possible, very gentle, foreign to threats & wars—but dangerous
PIO.linkedContent: impossibility of inventing the other, thus only invention: beyond the possible, very gentle, foreign to threats & wars—but dangerous

PF.content: to take other in w/out lodging chez soi is one formula for the possibility of the impossible
PF.linkedContent: to take other in w/out lodging chez soi is one formula for the possibility of the impossible

PF.content: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen
PF.linkedContent: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen

PF.content: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”
PF.linkedContent: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”

TR.content: necessary/possible to account [?] for suffering, wound, trauma (of desire, living movement, proper body) via machine: machine’s possibility produces such desire, the “as if,” the quasi, the simulacrum, expropriation > giving an account is impossible because: condition of possibility is the condition of impossibility
TR.linkedContent: necessary/possible to account [?] for suffering, wound, trauma (of desire, living movement, proper body) via machine: machine’s possibility produces such desire, the “as if,” the quasi, the simulacrum, expropriation > giving an account is impossible because: condition of possibility is the condition of impossibility

TR.content: [re: impossible conditions of possible] place of thought that ought to be devoted to virtualization of the event by the machine: exceeds classical determinations of possibility (dynamis, power, Möglichkeit), exceeds classical opposition possible/impossible
TR.linkedContent: [re: impossible conditions of possible] place of thought that ought to be devoted to virtualization of the event by the machine: exceeds classical determinations of possibility (dynamis, power, Möglichkeit), exceeds classical opposition possible/impossible

TR.content: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)
TR.linkedContent: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)

PJP.content: even more impossible than report-confession: countersignature of acolyte (most impossible impossible: narrator himself) > unique impossibility [cf. IW p. 287 particular nothing]
PJP.linkedContent: even more impossible than report-confession: countersignature of acolyte (most impossible impossible: narrator himself) > unique impossibility [cf. IW p. 287 particular nothing]

PJP.content: acolyte, narrator-friend-witness-countersignatory, “I am myself the rapport,” relation w/out relation, the impossible report/relation (and translation)
PJP.linkedContent: acolyte, narrator-friend-witness-countersignatory, “I am myself the rapport,” relation w/out relation, the impossible report/relation (and translation)

PSSS.content: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other

PSSS.content: numerous figures of the impossible: hospitality, forgiveness, gift—above all [?] the “perhaps,” the “what if,” the unpredictability of event
PSSS.linkedContent: numerous figures of the impossible: hospitality, forgiveness, gift—above all [?] the “perhaps,” the “what if,” the unpredictability of event

PSSS.content: originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart
PSSS.linkedContent: originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart

HST.content: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible
HST.linkedContent: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible

HST.content: [Derrida's classic logic of the impossible] to forgive the unforgivable is impossible: since forgiveness can only forgive the unforgivable, forgiveness must do the impossible
HST.linkedContent: [Derrida's classic logic of the impossible] to forgive the unforgivable is impossible: since forgiveness can only forgive the unforgivable, forgiveness must do the impossible

HST.content: forgiveness merges (se confondre) w/ l’épreuve of aporia: possibility of impossible, impossible of the possible
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness merges (se confondre) w/ l’épreuve of aporia: possibility of impossible, impossible of the possible

HST.content: forgiveness, hospitality, gift, affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness, hospitality, gift, affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable

HST.content: impossibility of the possible, possible of the impossible has an affinity w/ what Heidegger says of death [cf. A p. 68 for a different take?] > links gift of death w/ gift of forgiveness: where is forgiveness more impossible than border btwn living/dead?
HST.linkedContent: impossibility of the possible, possible of the impossible has an affinity w/ what Heidegger says of death [cf. A p. 68 for a different take?] > links gift of death w/ gift of forgiveness: where is forgiveness more impossible than border btwn living/dead?

HST.content: 397 the definition of (a) today, sursis de vie, reconciliation in the impossible > great forgiveness as test/ordeal of unforgivable [re: 2 enemy Jews comically forgiving each other]
HST.linkedContent: 397 the definition of (a) today, sursis de vie, reconciliation in the impossible > great forgiveness as test/ordeal of unforgivable [re: 2 enemy Jews comically forgiving each other]

EL.content: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place
EL.linkedContent: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place

C.content: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)
C.linkedContent: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)

LI.content: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible
LI.linkedContent: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible

TN.content: penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible
TN.linkedContent: penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible

TN.content: Nancy’s power of powerlessness, possibility of the impossible
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s power of powerlessness, possibility of the impossible

TN.content: il faut s’aimer [French grammar: puts transitivity in reflexivity] says every “I love you” > this (impossible) auto-affection of love makes love possible
TN.linkedContent: il faut s’aimer [French grammar: puts transitivity in reflexivity] says every “I love you” > this (impossible) auto-affection of love makes love possible

AD.content: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary
AD.linkedContent: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary

AD.content: for Levinas, “substitution,” absolute passivity, “possibility of the impossible” that’s not Heidegger’s death, but the condition of the hostage, responsibility before/beyond death— impossibility of “slipping away (se dérober)”
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, “substitution,” absolute passivity, “possibility of the impossible” that’s not Heidegger’s death, but the condition of the hostage, responsibility before/beyond death— impossibility of “slipping away (se dérober)”

OG.content: differance, breathing space, finitude, death makes presence/absence possible: makes possible very thing it makes impossible, produces what it forbids [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]: non-satisfaction (inassouvissement)
OG.linkedContent: differance, breathing space, finitude, death makes presence/absence possible: makes possible very thing it makes impossible, produces what it forbids [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]: non-satisfaction (inassouvissement)

OG.content: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)
OG.linkedContent: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)

OG.content: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”
OG.linkedContent: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”

UWC.content: [all the impossibles] gift, forgiveness, invention, justice, friendship, hospitality, etc. confirm thinking of impossible possible, possible as impossible, an impossible-possible that can’t be determined by metaphysical interpretation of possibility or virtuality
UWC.linkedContent: [all the impossibles] gift, forgiveness, invention, justice, friendship, hospitality, etc. confirm thinking of impossible possible, possible as impossible, an impossible-possible that can’t be determined by metaphysical interpretation of possibility or virtuality

UWC.content: this thinking of impossible possible is not a thinking of necessity but a thinking of the dangerous “perhaps” > force of event always stronger than performative
UWC.linkedContent: this thinking of impossible possible is not a thinking of necessity but a thinking of the dangerous “perhaps” > force of event always stronger than performative

UWC.content: sovereign mastery of interior (proper power) ([indivisible] border of inside/outside) vs. divisible limit  (because divisible, it has a history) > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the “perhaps,” the “if”
UWC.linkedContent: sovereign mastery of interior (proper power) ([indivisible] border of inside/outside) vs. divisible limit (because divisible, it has a history) > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the “perhaps,” the “if”

CIR.content: my impossible homosexuality, always associated w/ name Claude
CIR.linkedContent: my impossible homosexuality, always associated w/ name Claude

SPEC.content: [Freud’s death drive] autoteleguiding, suicide deferred, wishes to sound its own glas, wishes the impossible > most driven drive is drive of the proper, reappropriate oneself
